questions.question: The Constitution created a more perfect union by doing which of the following

choices.answer: Separating power among three banches of the Federal Government
Creating a system in which each of the Branches can 'check' another branch
Allowing the Fed Gov to share or give up some of its power to the states
All of the Above

questions.question: TheExecutive Branch's job is to execute or carry out laws. This means...

choices.answer: he/she personally makes sure each law in the US is being followed
He/She delegates to others in the branch to make sure laws are followed
He/She monitors the daily lives of Americans
He/She gives the laws to the states so they can follow them
Is the least powerful of the three branches
Reviews laws to make sure they are constitutional
Makes laws and taxes for Americans to follow
Advises the President on executive orders

questions.question: One way that the Judicial Branch can check the Legislative Branch is by...

choices.answer: Asking congress members to rewrite laws before thye become a law
Approve the members of the Legislative Branch
Use the Power of Judicial Review to determine if a law is unconstitutional
Approve Treaties made by the Legislative Branch

questions.question: What is the definition of Federalism

choices.answer: A system of shared power between state and national governments
A system that separates the power between the three branches of government
A system that keeps the Chief Executive's power limited
A system that gives all power and authority to the national government.

questions.question: How can the Executive Branch limit the power of the Legislative Branch?

choices.answer: Creating tax bills
Creating Treaties
Declaring war
Vetoing Laws

questions.question: How can the Legislative Branch check the Executive Branch?

choices.answer: Vote to Impeach the President
Decide when the electoral college casts their vote
Set term limits for the President
Declare actions of the Chief Executive unconstitutional

questions.question: Which of the following powers is reserved for the states?

choices.answer: Declare war
Create Taxes
Make Treaties
Operate Schools

questions.question: Which of the following powers is reserved exclusively for the National Government?

choices.answer: Create Laws
Print and coin Money
Build Roads
Issue Driver's Licenses

questions.question: What is a power shared by both the State and Federal governments?

choices.answer: Declare war
Make treaties with other nations
Build Roads
They have no shared powers
